title: Famous Director Helps Actor's Family
summary: Steven Spielberg, a famous movie director, gave $25,000 to help the family of James Van Der Beek, an actor who passed away. James was known for a TV show called Dawson's Creek and had six children. He died from bowel cancer, and his family needed money for medical bills. Other celebrities like Zoe Saldaña-Perego and Jon M Chu also donated money. A GoFundMe page collected over $2 million to support the family. Spielberg never worked with James, but James was a big fan of his movies. The family thanked everyone for their kindness and love during this sad time.

background_read: James Van Der Beek was an actor who starred in the TV show Dawson's Creek from 1998 to 2003. He passed away at age 48 from bowel cancer, leaving behind his wife and six children. To help with medical costs, a GoFundMe page was set up, and many people, including famous director Steven Spielberg, donated money. Spielberg is known for movies like ET and Schindler's List, and James was a fan of his work. This story shows how communities come together to support families in need.
